data.name: MissingAttributeMessage
data.value: Missing '{0}' attribute.

data.name: MissingDiagnosticAnalyzerAttributeTitle
data.value: Missing diagnostic analyzer attribute.

data.name: MissingDiagnosticAnalyzerAttributeDescription
data.value: Non-abstract sub-types of DiagnosticAnalyzer should be marked with DiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute(s). The argument to this attribute(s), if any, determine the supported languages for the analyzer. Analyzer types without this attribute will be ignored by the analysis engine.

data.name: AddLanguageSupportToAnalyzerMessage
data.value: Diagnostic analyzer '{0}' may be able to support both C# and Visual Basic. Consider adding an argument to DiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute for '{1}' language support.

data.name: AddLanguageSupportToAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Recommend adding language support to diagnostic analyzer.

data.name: AddLanguageSupportToAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Diagnostic analyzer is marked as supporting only one language, but the analyzer assembly doesn't seem to refer to any language specific CodeAnalysis assemblies, and so is likely to work for more than one language. Consider adding an additional language argument to DiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute.

data.name: ApplyDiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute_1
data.value: Apply DiagnosticAnalyzer attribute for '{0}'.

data.name: ApplyDiagnosticAnalyzerAttribute_2
data.value: Apply DiagnosticAnalyzer attribute for both '{0}' and '{1}'.

data.name: MissingKindArgumentToRegisterActionMessage
data.value: Specify at least one '{0}' of interest while registering a {1} analyzer action.

data.name: MissingKindArgumentToRegisterActionTitle
data.value: Missing kind argument while registering an analyzer action.

data.name: MissingKindArgumentToRegisterActionDescription
data.value: You must specify at least one syntax/symbol kinds of interest while registering a syntax/symbol analyzer action. Otherwise, the registered action will be dead code and will never be invoked during analysis.

data.name: UnsupportedSymbolKindArgumentToRegisterActionMessage
data.value: SymbolKind '{0}' is not supported for symbol analyzer actions.

data.name: UnsupportedSymbolKindArgumentToRegisterActionTitle
data.value: Unsupported SymbolKind argument while registering a symbol analyzer action.

data.name: InvalidReportDiagnosticMessage
data.value: ReportDiagnostic invoked with an unsupported DiagnosticDescriptor '{0}'.

data.name: InvalidReportDiagnosticTitle
data.value: ReportDiagnostic invoked with an unsupported DiagnosticDescriptor.

data.name: InvalidReportDiagnosticDescription
data.value: ReportDiagnostic should only be invoked with supported DiagnosticDescriptors that are returned from DiagnosticAnalyzer.SupportedDiagnostics property. Otherwise, the reported diagnostic will be filtered out by the analysis engine.

data.name: InvalidSyntaxKindTypeArgumentMessage
data.value: Type argument '{0}' for type parameter '{1}' of method '{2}' is not a SyntaxKind enum.

data.name: InvalidSyntaxKindTypeArgumentTitle
data.value: Invalid type argument for DiagnosticAnalyzer's Register method.

data.name: InvalidSyntaxKindTypeArgumentDescription
data.value: DiagnosticAnalyzer's language-specific Register methods, such as RegisterSyntaxNodeAction, RegisterCodeBlockStartAction and RegisterCodeBlockEndAction, expect a language-specific 'SyntaxKind' type argument for it's '{0}' type parameter. Otherwise, the registered analyzer action can never be invoked during analysis.

data.name: StartActionWithOnlyEndActionTitle
data.value: Start action has no registered non-end actions.

data.name: StartActionWithNoRegisteredActionsMessage
data.value: '{0}' does not register any analyzer actions. Consider moving actions registered in '{1}' that depend on this start action to '{0}'.

data.name: StartActionWithNoRegisteredActionsTitle
data.value: Start action has no registered actions.

data.name: StartActionWithOnlyEndActionMessage
data.value: '{0}' does not register any analyzer actions, except for a '{1}'. Consider replacing this start/end action pair with a '{2}' or moving actions registered in '{3}' that depend on this start action to '{0}'.

data.name: StatefulAnalyzerRegisterActionsDescription
data.value: An analyzer start action enables performing stateful analysis over a given code unit, such as a code block, compilation, etc. Careful design is necessary to achieve efficient analyzer execution without memory leaks. Use the following guidelines for writing such analyzers: 1. Define a new scope for the registered start action, possibly with a private nested type for analyzing each code unit. 2. If required, define and initialize state in the start action. 3. Register at least one non-end action that refers to this state in the start action. If no such action is necessary, consider replacing the start action with a non-start action. For example, a CodeBlockStartAction with no registered actions or only a registered CodeBlockEndAction should be replaced with a CodeBlockAction. 4. If required, register an end action to report diagnostics based on the final state.

data.name: UseLocalizableStringsInDescriptorMessage
data.value: Consider providing localizable arguments of type '{0}' to diagnostic descriptor constructor to ensure the descriptor is localizable.

data.name: UseLocalizableStringsInDescriptorTitle
data.value: Provide localizable arguments to diagnostic descriptor constructor.

data.name: UseLocalizableStringsInDescriptorDescription
data.value: If your diagnostic analyzer and it's reported diagnostics need to be localizable, then the supported DiagnosticDescriptors used for constructing the diagnostics must also be localizable. If so, then localizable argument(s) must be provided for parameter 'title' (and optionally 'description') to the diagnostic descriptor constructor to ensure that the descriptor is localizable.

data.name: DoNotStorePerCompilationDataOntoFieldsMessage
data.value: Avoid storing per-compilation data of type '{0}' into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer.

data.name: DoNotStorePerCompilationDataOntoFieldsTitle
data.value: Avoid storing per-compilation data into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer.

data.name: DoNotStorePerCompilationDataOntoFieldsDescription
data.value: Instance of a diagnostic analyzer might outlive the lifetime of compilation. Hence, storing per-compilation data, such as symbols, into the fields of a diagnostic analyzer might cause stale compilations to stay alive and cause memory leaks. Instead, you should store this data on a separate type instantiatied in a compilation start action, registered using '{0}.{1}' API. An instance of this type will be created per-compilation and it won't outlive compilation's lifetime, hence avoiding memory leaks.

data.name: InternalImplementationOnlyDescription
data.value: The author of this interface did not intend to have third party implementations of this interface and reserves the right to change it. Implementing this interface could therefore result in a source or binary compatibility issue with a future version of this interface.

data.name: InternalImplementationOnlyMessage
data.value: Type {0} cannot implement interface {1} because {1} is not available for public implementation.

data.name: InternalImplementationOnlyTitle
data.value: Only internal implementations of this interface are allowed.

data.name: CodeActionNeedsEquivalenceKeyDescription
data.value: A CodeFixProvider that intends to support fix all occurrences must classify the registered code actions into equivalence classes by assigning it an explicit, non-null equivalence key which is unique across all registered code actions by this fixer. This enables the FixAllProvider to fix all diagnostics in the required scope by applying code actions from this fixer that are in the equivalence class of the trigger code action.

data.name: CreateCodeActionWithEquivalenceKeyMessage
data.value: Provide an explicit argument for optional parameter '{0}', which is non-null and unique across all code actions created by this fixer.

data.name: CreateCodeActionWithEquivalenceKeyTitle
data.value: Create code actions should have a unique EquivalenceKey for FixAll occurrences support.

data.name: OverrideCodeActionEquivalenceKeyMessage
data.value: '{0}' has the default value of 'null' for property '{1}'. Either override this property on '{0}' to return a non-null and unique value across all code actions per-fixer or use such an existing code action.

data.name: OverrideCodeActionEquivalenceKeyTitle
data.value: Use code actions that have a unique EquivalenceKey for FixAll occurrences support.
